page.title: 11CHANGES IN WILLOUGHBY
page.content: weather was dry, water had to be collected from the pond and boiled before drinking. The{wells}were closed because a 6-year old twin fell down one of them and was drowned.{Milk}was bought from local farms, but is now delivered daily from a local dairy. There used to be 2{pubs}in the village but now there is only one and the {blacksmith}closed down due to lack of demand.After the war there was one{bus twice a week but now we have about 5 buses everyday serving Nottingham and Leicester.There were no telephones so people had to travel everywhere.Most people travelled on{bikes.}In the village there lived a village policeman and a road sweeper.Most people in the village would have a maid of their own to help look after the larger houses.{Farming}life has changed very much since the war.There
